intro: Centaurea matthiolifolia, commonly known as the Matthiola centaurea, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are usually pink to purple in color, blooming from late spring to early autumn. Centaurea matthiolifolia is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
